name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, gbeaton, ovenface)

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, chivalress, whoper, NDCaesar, Scorpio_nadir, Lumus, Zem, Doc_Rostov, saucy_jack, Panserbjorne)

name: saucy_jack
text: People don't leave lames because they think it is wrong to disagree with the majority opinion. They leave lames because they think you are wrong.

name: rowboat
text:
Yeah, I guess I was just feelin' bitchy when I wrote that second one. It's funny, 'cause I hate those kind of victimized, whiny responses to getting lamed for naysaying.

Anyway, I should have known better. I've been here long enough to know what I can't say.

name: doc_rostov
text:
It isn't that you had a different opinion or that you "can't" say something. That's an odd way to look at it. The first comment was lamed because some people on Assetbar think lames are equivalent to candy. That's never going to stop. The other was lamed because you had to be a prig about it. I mean, that sounded like some Asherdan level "waah why are you laming me" for a second! Coming from Rowboat? Come on, man, most of the time you're pretty hilarious. You gotta know that just isn't kosher. Whining about lames--especially some paltry number of them, like 3--is really weird coming from you, not gonna lie.

Oh, crud. I forgot. I'm Cornelius!

Goodness me!

name: rowboat
text: We all have our weak moments.

name: mcjuicy
text: rowboat is weak

name: rowboat
text: And who the fuck are you?

name: landowmpg
text: This thread did not deliver closure.

name: rowboat
text: We all lived happily ever after. Except mcjuicy, who tragically choked to death on my enormous fucking cock.

name: anticitizen
text:
all of your posts are wonderful because I can't help but imagine them in Patrick Bateman's slow, deliberately enunciated manner of speaking.

"Probably the one with Lyle's hatred of gorillas... do you like Phil Collins?"

so on and so forth, axe this, chainsaw that.
